intro: Abutilon laxiflorum, commonly known as the woolly abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, lantern-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Abutilon laxiflorum is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.

It is commonly found in coastal areas and along the edges of chaparral and scrub habitats. Its native range also extends into parts of Baja California, Mexico.
distribution_introduced_art_desc: Abutilon laxiflorum was mainly introduced to areas with a temperate climate, particularly in regions of the United States and parts of Europe.
